reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we pulled the car into the drive, we knew we booked the perfect hotel for us. We were warmly greeted at the front desk by Peter and a female employee. Peter gave us lots of helpful information about the hotel. For those expecting the Ritz Carlton and its amenities- this is not. But, the Trianon Old Naples is a beautiful, charming hotel that has comfortable beds with quality linens, large rooms, a friendly and helpful staff (all shifts). The complimentary continental breakfast consists of bagels, breads, muffins, danish, cereals, fruit, juices, and coffee/tea - more than adequate for a continental breakfast. Something that I loved was that after enjoying breakfast, I could grab a coffee to go from the buffet for our early morning walk since cups and lids were also provided. The location is perfect to walk to 5th Avenue restaurants and shops ( 2 blocks away) and to Tin City (2 blocks the other way).
reviews.title: Perfect Location in Old Naples

reviews.text: We decided to leave the car at the hotel and walk to the beach many times (about 8 -10 blocks). Naples Pier was only a few blocks further once at the beach. Since we traveled in mid/late July, brief thunderstorms can be normal in late afternoon. When late day showers were forecasted, we drove to the beach – be sure to have quarters for parking.
reviews.title: Nice for the price

reviews.text: There is a pool and towels provided for use in the pool area (pack beach towels). The pool was refreshing and comfortable. Some days, it was busy but only for a short time.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is free wifi in the room, hotel lobby and pool area.
reviews.title: I thik the hotel was posh once

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at the Trianon Old Naples and cannot say enough about the staff. Everyone was kind, courteous, and extremely helpful!
reviews.title: A PLEASURE TO BE THERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm actually from Naples, so I can say the location IS perfect. And i found the staff helpful and polite. The breakfast was also nice to have, though options were limited. BUT the rooms are Best Western quality and the views are not what you come to Naples for. I also would have liked to see a much better pool (don't bother) and some kind of fitness center. (The room manual directs you an off site to a location that was torn down a while back). Do yourself a favor and head a little ways up the road to the Naples Bay Resort. The views are amazing, the off season rates a STEAL for the quality and the pool area is like being in a Carribean resort-- complete with lazy river.
reviews.title: Eh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're walkers when we vacation...the Trianon was perfect for us. Walk out the front door, turn right, walk two short blocks and you are in the heart of 5th Avenue. You can also easily make it to the beach for sunsets and the shops/restaurants on 3rd Street. For those looking to pick up some cheap goodies, Tin City is two blocks to the East. You just can't ask for a better value for the location. We didn't get his name, but the young man working the front desk was polite, helpful and friendly throughout our stay. We will be returning to the Trianon in May.
reviews.title: Location is perfect, Hotel is exceptional value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Trianon in Old Naples for the 3rd year in a row and enjoy it immensely. Clean, in a quiet neighborhood, nice rooms, pleasant and private pool and of course the excellent location just 3 blocks from 5th Avenue with all of its shops and restaurants make this a perfect choice and location to stay.
reviews.title: Third Stay at the Trianon - consistently good!

reviews.text: Hans and Peter are friendly, helpful concierges. My only recommendation to management would be to improve the morning breakfast. Some fresh fruit would be wonderful.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel, and you can easily walk to 5th Ave. Old Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with reasonable rates, nice rooms and nice pool. This not a full service hotel (no bar or restaurant). They put a nice breakfast out each morning. Rooms are unique and much more luxurious than the cookie-cutter chain hotels. Pool is fine.
reviews.title: Great location with old charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Living in Fort Lauderdale we LOVE to take a weekend getaway to the west coast of FL and have stayed at Beach Club, Naples Beach Grande which are way to crowded during the summer. We always gravitate back to the Trianon right off Fifth Ave., you don't even need to drive. Perfect, quiet boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Added bonus, Tempurpedic beds!
reviews.title: An unexpected GEM

reviews.text: From the well decorated lobby and breakfast/bar area to the oversized deluxe double room, this hotel was an excellent choice for our "getaway" weekend. Only two blocks from 5th Ave South with all the shops and restaurants, the location proved to be outstanding. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful, the pool area was well kept and the room and the bathroom were exceptionally clean and tidy. The continental breakfast included bagels, muffins, danish, cereal, juice and some fresh fruit. The beaches were mostly public and an easy walk, about 8 blocks, to the Gulf. The Naples Pier was a 5 minute car ride and had metered street parking and parking lot. We loved the great location, value and service of the Trianon--it is truly a GEM!!!
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.text: Just stayed the one night on a trip to the Everglades. Booked King bedded rooms at a 'name your own rate' of $79.00 which was good value, included a continental breakfast. Hotel is a short stroll from 5th Avenue with its boutiques and restaurants (mainly expensive). Hotel itself was very comfortable, small bar and pool area but not a lot else in terms of public areas. If in the area would stay again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a perfect location
small welcoming hotel in central location
reviews.text: This is a great little find this hotel, it's in a great location only 5 minute walk from the main stret 5th Avenue where all the shops and restaurants are. We had a lovely big room/bathroom and it was spotlessly clean. Breakfast is more than adequate and you can sit and eat in the lovely outside courtyard. This is a small hotel with not many rooms but it has a beautiful lobby area and a great little swimming pool out back, not flash, but does not need to be. Would definitely recommend this hotel!! Naples is a wonderful place to visit, make sure you do a cruise to see all the lovely homes on the waterfront, do the trolley tour to get your bearings and at night head to 5th Avenue where it is lit up with lights at night! Can't wait to go back again!!

Very nice little hotel! Excellent location, two short blocks from 5th Ave. Spacious room, very comfortable beds, and we found the breakfast more than adequate. It says "continental", after all. We went to the pool only once, but the ocean is just a few minutes away...
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a little over a week there with friends. The rooms were very nice and the bed fantastic though the breakfast was very limited in fact not as good as some lower priced hotels such as a Holiday Inn and the pool area was noisy with street and air traffic. Good location to town , near restaurants and shops and parking was convenient. The staff was not overly friendly and on one occasion was downright rude. The price was expensive for the amenities offered.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, noisy, poor breakfast, rude staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place. the location was tops for walking everywhere. Our room was very spacious and clean. Peter and Hans at the front desk were most helpful with any inquires and lots of suggestions for what to do. The continental breakfast was fairly sparse so we would walk to "The Cafe" on 5th Ave for a great breakfast and fabulous coffee to start the day. A great way to end the day is at the Bice restaurant ( also on 5th Ave) - happy hour from 4:00 to 6:00pm - wine, beer and certain drinks 2 for 1 along with a great free anitpasto buffet. The live music set the atmosphere...
reviews.title: a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trianon is a lovely quite place for respite and old style elegance.
reviews.title: A quaint, friendly, clean, peaceful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the comments below! We flew in from Miami airport and drove to the hotel which was easy to find after the long flight. We had a lovely relaxing time at this hotel. We found the staff very friendly and helpful when we had any queries. The double room we were allocated was great, nice and clean. The breakfast was what you would expect from a continental option! Spot on location to 5th avenue restaurants and shops, the beach and Tin City.
reviews.title: One man's meat
